replies.bodyText:
@ibacher Shouldn't this be SP_RELATED_TYPE here is why I think so.
Also only changing the data type will not solve the problems, I think that we'll have to map it, as we did for Task also the observation resource returns IBundleProvider in search function which complicates things or if not all the tests are failing with this error message
ca.uhn.fhir.context.ConfigurationException: This context is for FHIR version "DSTU3" but the class "org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.OperationOutcome" is for version "R4"


I guess we'll need to override this method also in BaseFhirR3ResourceProviderTest
replies.author: VaishSiddharth

replies.bodyText:
No. SP_RELATED. SP_RELATED_TYPE refers to the type structure that is part of the related element. Technically, SP_RELATED_TARGET is the more direct replacement for SP_HAS_MEMBER, but only when the related structure looks like this:
"related": {
    "type": "has-member",
    "target": "Observation/3"
}
Or, in terms of search parameters:
/Observation?related.type=has-member&related.target=Observation/3

This also isn't exactly like Task, because what we're converting here isn't a full resource, but a search parameter.
The message you highlight:
ca.uhn.fhir.context.ConfigurationException: This context is for FHIR version "DSTU3" but the class "org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.OperationOutcome" is for version "R4"

Does indicate a problem, but part of the problem is that we're not properly handling things when the result is an OperationOutcome (which itself needs to be translated). Please step through one of these failing tests with a debugger to see what is actually happening.

I guess we'll need to override this method also in BaseFhirR3ResourceProviderTest

Which method are you referring to?
replies.author: ibacher
VaishSiddharth

timeline.bodyText: I would make this UNKNOWN. Also I would order the values in the enum this way: UNKNOWN, R3, R4. That way we're adding values to the end and (hopefully) not messing up the ordinal order of the enum.
